member.name: T:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer
member.summary: An optimized method for drawing static procedural content.
member.remarks: This still suffers from multiple SetPass calls associated with the UnityEngine.Rendering.CommandBuffer. It should be possible in the future to using GraphicsBuffers/BatchRenderGroup once that API stabilizes.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.DefaultMaximumVerticesPerMesh
member.summary: The default maximum number of vertices per meshReference when dynamically creating meshes.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.CubeSegmentIndices
member.summary: The ordered segment index pairs used to describe a cube.
member.remarks: This effectively wraps the left side, then the right, then connects the two sides.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.s_DottedLineMaterial
member.summary: The base instance of the default dotted line material.
member.remarks: This will be cloned when a new color value is provided and not found by GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.GetDottedLineMaterialByColor(UnityEngine.Color).

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.s_LineMaterial
member.summary: The base instance of the default line material.
member.remarks: This will be cloned when a new color value is provided and not found by GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.GetSolidLineMaterialByColor(UnityEngine.Color).

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.s_LineSegmentIndices
member.summary: The ordered segment index pairs used to describe a line.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.Key
member.summary: The associated System.Int32 key with the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.

remarks.para: This is useful for identifying the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer in different contexts; its specific use is meant for being able to recall a GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer from the GDX.Developer.DebugDraw.

A common pattern is to use the the UnityEngine.GameObject's InstanceID or an Entity Number to create a unique indexer. Collisions can occur if you are not careful about how you index your GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_CommandBuffer
member.summary: The actual allocated UnityEngine.Rendering.CommandBuffer used by the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_MaximumVerticesPerMesh
member.summary: The established maximum number of vertices per meshReference for this particular GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.
member.remarks: Once this is set in the constructor it cannot be changed. Arbitrary meshReference adds are not effected by this

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_CurrentToken
member.summary: The current incremental token used when associating draw commands.
member.remarks: This is used to provide a stable index in an extremely simple form. While it will eventually roll over, at that threshold you should be considering if multiple GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer may be more optimal.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_DottedLineMaterials
member.summary: An indexed dictionary of all dotted line materials, referenced by the hashcode of the color.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_DrawCommands
member.summary: An indexed dictionary of all of the draw commands to use with the buffer.
member.remarks: This includes the meshReference and an index of the material to use with that meshReference when drawing. As items are added, the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_CurrentToken is incremented to simulate a stable ID.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_LineMaterials
member.summary: An indexed dictionary of all line materials, referenced by the hashcode of the color.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_Materials
member.summary: An ever expanding list of materials used with the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.
member.remarks: Both GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_DottedLineMaterials and GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_LineMaterials store indexes of UnityEngine.Materials inside of this list.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_WorkingPoints
member.summary: A storage of working vertices information indexed based on the hashcode of the material it is meant to be drawn with.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_WorkingSegments
member.summary: A storage of working segment indices pairs indexed based on the hashcode of the material it is meant to be drawn with.

member.name: F:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.m_WorkingTokens
member.summary: A storage of working expected tokens of meshes to be created in the future.

member.summary: Create a GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.

An initial allocation of the expected number of materials that will be used.

member.name: P:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.Finalized
member.summary: Has the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer been converged?
member.remarks: A finalized GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer has had its command buffer filled with the fixed draw calls based on the meshes/materials outlined. If a meshReference is invalidated by GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.Invalidate(System.Int32), the GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer will become not finalized and will re-converge itself next GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.Execute.

member.name: M:GDX.Developer.DebugDrawBuffer.Converge
member.summary: Converges all working vertices/material additions into finalized meshReference forms and fills the command buffer with the appropriate data.

member.name: T:GDX.Collections.Generic.SerializableDictionary`2
member.summary: A Unity serializable System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.

remarks.para: This will NOT work with System.Object based objects, use UnityEngine.Object if you must. While .NET has solutions for creating custom serialization paths, Unity uses its own system to serialize data into YAML structures. This also assumes that the types provided can be serialized by Unity.
The process of serializing and deserializing this dictionary should not be considered performant.
The property drawer will not show structs, it will be blank. It does work however if done through code.

member.name: T:GDX.Collections.FreeList
member.summary: An array where indices are allocated from and stored in an in-place linked list. Allocating or deallocating a single int from this array is very fast, as is single datum lookup, but neither the allocated indices nor the free indices can be reliably iterated without an external data structure. This structure can be adapted to an arbitrary of external, parallel arrays.

member.name: M:GDX.StringExtensions.GetStableHashCode(System.String)

summary.para: Get the stable hash code value of targetString.

member.remarks: This loosely based on the FowlerNollVo (FNV) hash function. It's value will be identical to the value produced natively by processing a System.String with System.String.GetHashCode, but with no allocations and no virtual calls.
member.param: The target System.String.
member.returns: A System.Int32 value.

member.returns: A System.Int32 value.

member.name: M:GDX.StringExtensions.IsNumeric(System.String)
member.summary: Is the targetString a numeric value.

remarks.para: The following requirements must be met to be considered a valid number in this method:

item.description: The first character may be an indicator of its sign, an explicit acceptance of - is made. If prefixed with +, the number will be found invalid.
A single decimal point . may be present in the targetString.
No alphabet characters are present in the targetString.

member.param: The target System.String.
member.returns: true/false if the targetString qualifies as a numeric value.

member.summary: A running tally of bits that are blocked by the currently executing tasks.

member.remarks: This will add a task to the GDX.Threading.TaskDirector if it does not already know about it, regardless of the current blocking mode status. Do not use this method to add non executing tasks, they will not be added to the GDX.Threading.TaskDirector in this way.
member.param: An established task.

member.summary: Validate that all parent directories are created for a given filePath.
member.param: The path to process and validate.

member.summary: Validate that the file path is writable, making the necessary folder structure and setting permissions.
member.param: The absolute path to validate.

member.summary: Use our best attempt to remove a file at the designated filePath.
member.param: The file path to remove forcefully.

member.name: M:GDX.Platform.GetHardwareGeneration
member.summary: Gets the current platforms hardware generation number?
member.returns: Returns 0 for base hardware, 1 for updates.

member.name: M:GDX.Platform.GetOutputFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a runtime writable folder.
member.param: An optional additional folder under the provided path that will be created if necessary.
member.returns: The full path to a writable folder at runtime.
member.remarks:
Depending on the platform, different routes are taken to finding a writable folder.
Editor The project's root folder is used in this case.
Standard Player Utilizes P:UnityEngine.Application.persistentDataPath to find a suitable place.
DOTS Runtime Uses System.IO.Directory.GetCurrentDirectory.
The path can be overridden by assigning GDX_OUTPUT_FOLDER in the launching arguments.

member.name: M:GDX.Platform.IsFocused

member.remarks: There are issues on some platforms with getting an accurate reading.
member.returns: true/false if the application has focus.

member.name: M:GDX.Platform.IsFileWritable(System.String)
member.summary: Is it safe to write to the indicated filePath?
member.param: The file path to check if it can be written.
member.returns: true/false if the path can be written too.

member.name: M:GDX.Platform.IsHeadless
member.summary: Is the application running in headless mode?.
member.remarks: Useful for detecting running a server.
member.returns: true/false if the application is without an initialized graphics device.

member.name: T:GDX.Trace

member.name: T:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel
member.summary: Trace Levels

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Info
member.summary: A trivial informational entry.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Log
member.summary: An entry indicating something which might be useful to provide context.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Warning
member.summary: An issue has been found but handled.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Error
member.summary: An error has occurred which may be recoverable, but notification is required.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Exception
member.summary: An exception has occured and needs to be flagged up for resolution. The should never happen in a release environment.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Assertion
member.summary: An assertion based event has occured and has some sort of messaging to be recorded.

member.name: F:GDX.Trace.TraceLevel.Fatal
member.summary: A fatal error has occured which needs to be logged, and the program will subsequently crash.

member.name: M:GDX.Trace.Output(GDX.Trace.TraceLevel,System.Object,UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Log a trace message to the appropriate subscribers and the Unity console where applicable with additional context on invoke location.
member.param: The GDX.Trace.TraceLevel of the particular message.
An System.Object representing the message to be recorded.
An UnityEngine.Object indicating context for the given message.
Automatically filled out member name which invoked this method.
Automatically filled out source code path of the invoking method.
Automatically filled out line number of the invoking method.

member.name: M:GDX.GameObjectExtensions.GetFirstComponentInChildrenComplex``1(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)

The internal UnityEngine.Component.GetComponentInChildren``1(System.Boolean) has optimizations internally in engine code which make it faster in different scenarios.

Should children UnityEngine.GameObject be searched before the targetGameObject's UnityEngine.GameObject.
Include inactive child UnityEngine.GameObjects when looking for the UnityEngine.Component.

member.typeparam: The target UnityEngine.Component type that is being looked for.
member.returns: The first found UnityEngine.Component.
